content.title: アンビガは警察、平和的な反Icerd集会のための主催者を称賛 -  Malaysiakini
content.desc: Malaysiakini Activist and seasoned rally attendee Ambiga Sreenevasan has lauded the organisers of today’s anti-Icerd rally, as well as the police, for ensuring a peaceful event. "I congratulate the organisers and police for a peaceful rally. Welcome to New Malaysia," she said on Twitter. Lawyer N Surendran, meanwhile, lauded media coverage of the event. "Nice to see live coverage of an oppositon rally on TV. This is truly Malaysia Baru. "Umno-BN please hang your head in shame! You never allowed coverage and demonised rallies," he tweeted. Tens of thousands had flocked to downtown Kuala Lumpur today to c...

content.title: マレーシア・トゥデー、反ICERD集会に出席して100万人に感謝
content.desc: (MMO) – Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today appeared unconcern with the mammoth anti-ICERD ‘thanksgiving’ rally, sarcastically thanking the one million people who turned up at the event. “We know that the gathering today was attended by one million people, and I thank them because they gathered for thanksgiving. One million people. Thank you,” he told a press conference here after the Pakatan Harapan (PH) Presidential Council meeting. He also gave himself a pat on the back, over his recent decision to not ratify the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial...

content.title: ICERDはマレー人対中国人に変身 - マレーシア本日
content.desc: Today’s rally and the Chinese response to the rally is evidence that the Malay-Chinese racial divide is permanent and can never be repaired. NO HOLDS BARRED Raja Petra Kamarudin Judging by the comments in the social media, WhatsApp groups, WeeChat groups, etc., it looks like the anti-ICERD rally today has been turned into a Malay versus Chinese affair. The Chinese comments show they are clearly opposed to today’s...

content.desc: KUALA LUMPUR: Police Federal Reserve Units (FRU) and police personnel are on standby in front of the Dang Wangi police district headquarters here. There are rumours that former premier Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak could be departing for the anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally from the police station. A team of police officers has also opened up a table by the sidewalk where they are enjoying a light meal. Lined up in front of the station are an FRU water cannon truck, five other red FRU trucks and seven dark blue police trucks w...

content.title: Dr M：明日のSuhakamイベントには出席できない -  Malaysia Today
content.desc: “I decided that we will not accept ICERD. Suhakam wants to accept ICERD. So, how can I go?” (FMT) – Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad has questioned how he will be able to attend a pro-human rights celebration tomorrow now that the government has taken an about-turn in ratifying ICERD. “I decided that we will not accept ICERD (the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination). “Suhakam (the Malaysian Human Rights Commission) wants to accept ICERD. “So, how can I go?” asked the Pakatan Harapan (PH) chairman after chairing the PH Presidential Council meet...

content.title: マレーシア：政府の弱さに対する懸念の中、マレーシア首脳会議 - アルジャジーラ英語
content.desc: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia - Tens of thousands of ethnic Malays have taken to the streets of Malaysia's capital to "celebrate" a government decision not to ratify a key UN anti-discrimination treaty, amid growing concerns the seven-month administration of Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad is losing reform momentum. Malaysia is one of only 14 countries in the world that have yet to sign the International Convention on the Elimination of all forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD). The treaty what constitutes racial discrimination and sets forth a series of principles and guidelines by which states ...

content.title: Dataran Merdeka、2pm反Icerdラリーより先行 -  The Star Online
content.desc: A crowd is building up at Dataran Merdeka as of 11.30am on Saturday (Dec 8). Anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally participants, mostly clad in white T-shirts with the 'anti-Icerd' printed in front, were seen bustling to Jalan Raja as police have blocked the adjacent roads along Jalan Hishammuddin and Jalan Tun Perak to motorists.

content.title: 両集会で期待される強力なシグナル - マレーシア・トゥデー
content.desc: In a sense, the anti-Icerd rally is a personal challenge to his leadership as the top Malay and Muslim leader. Joceline Tan, The Star THE line in the sand will be more clearly drawn than ever after tomorrow, with the predominantly Malay political opposition on one side and a more mixed ruling coalition on the other. The anti-Icerd rally engineered by PAS and Umno has all the signs of being the biggest Malay-Muslim street protest the country has ever seen in recent times. Parallels are being drawn to the mammoth Islamist rally in Jakarta last weekend that turned the biggest intersection in t...

content.title: 抗ICERD集会のための様々な場所からの風景 -  The Star Online
content.desc: Here are the afternoon scenes of the controversial anti-ICERD rally in Kuala Lumpur. Thousands are expected to converge at Dataran Merdeka to "celebrate" the Government's decision to not ratify the ICERD.

content.title: Suhakamは、人権の日のお祝いを日曜日（12月9日）に移します。
content.desc: KUALA LUMPUR: The Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam) will move its Human Rights Day celebration to Sunday (Dec 9). It tweeted on Friday (Dec 7): "Suhakam’s #HumanRightsDay celebration will now be held on 9 December 2018. Join us in #StandingUpForHumanRights." Earlier, Suhakam said it will be postponing their Human Rights Day celebration on Saturday (Dec 8). Suhakam chairman Tan Sri Razali Ismail said it is with "deep regret and disappointment" that the celebration will be postponed to a later date. He said that the police had informed them and the Prime Minister's Office, without...

content.title: Dr Mは、日曜日にSuhakamのHuman Rights Dayのお祝いに出席しません -  The Star Online
content.desc: PETALING JAYA: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will not be attending the Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam)’s Human Rights Day celebration on Sunday (Dec 9). Dr Mahathir explained that this was because the government had already decided against ratifying the International Convention on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination (Icerd), which was in contrary towards Suhakam’s stand on the contentious issue. “I decided that we will not accept Icerd. Suhakam wants to accept Icerd. So, how can I go,” he said. Dr Mahathir said this after chairing Pakatan Harapan’s presidential c...

content.title: ICERDを批准することができれば、なぜイスラエルも認めないのでしょうか？ - マレーシア本日
content.desc: If Shazwan is really sincere and serious about wanting ICERD, then he should also mention that ‘equality’ and ‘rights’ must also include the rights of Christians to preach Christianity to Muslims and for Muslims to leave Islam to become Christians (just like Muslims have the right to preach Islam to the Christians and for Christians to leave Christianity to become Muslims). Why is Shazwan not also propagating this if he wants ICERD? content.title: 同じ日に2回の大会が開催される - マレーシア・トゥデー
content.desc: (The Star) – This weekend, two major gatherings will take place in the Klang Valley, with both sides rallying to uphold human rights in their own context. As the anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) protesters gather in downtown Kuala Lumpur at Dataran Merdeka to celebrate the non-ratification of the United Nations covenant, in Padang Timur, Petaling Jaya, Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will be the chief guest in a celebration of universal human rights. The event in Petaling Jaya, which the organisers contend was planned thre...

content.title: 親愛なるPASとうーん、ここにあなたのために何かがラリーになる！ - マレーシア本日
content.desc: They can then snap a few pictures for Facebook and Instagram just to say “Hey, look at the support we have. We’re not irrelevant! Malays are united! Don’t challenge us!” (MMO) – So despite everything that’s happened in the past few weeks, PAS and Umno appear to be adamant about going ahead with the rally against the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD) tomorrow. Supporters have been mobilised from all states in the country, they say. T-shirts and colourful banners and slogans have been printed. The anger is real and cannot be contained, a...

content.title: パカタンの指導者、ラリージレンマに直面 - マレーシア本日
content.desc: (The Star) – Pakatan Hara­p­an leaders seem to be in a quandary as to whether disciplinary action should be taken against party members who attend tomorrow’s anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally organised by Umno and PAS. So far, no Pakatan party has issued a ban on members attending the anti-Icerd rally. PKR vice-president Zuraida Kamaruddin, however, said action should be taken against PKR members who attend the anti-Icerd rally as the party itself had said it is against the rally. Parti Amanah Nasional (Amanah) president Moh...

content.title: Mahathirを使用してプロICERD集会を組織するDAP  -  Malaysia Today
content.desc: “Muslims who plan to support Mahathir’s pro-human rights rally this Saturday will end up supporting ICERD. They need to understand, that the western concept of human rights isn’t recognised by the Islamic Syariat. Attend the rally, and you’ll end up supporting the right for non-Malays to enjoy the exact same privileges the Malays do. Worse, the western concept of human rights involves the need for one to accept homosexuality as a way of life and sodomy as an act condoned by law. Basically, if you’re Muslim and attending Mahathir’s rally, the DAP will call you a hypocrite for objecting ICERD...

content.title: Suhakamは土曜日（12月8日）に人権の日のお祝いを延期 - スターオンライン
content.desc: KUALA LUMPUR: The Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam) will be postponing their Human Rights Day celebration on Saturday (Dec 8). A source from the Commission confirmed this, but did not want to elaborate further. A press conference on this matter has been scheduled by the Commission at 4pm on Friday (Dec 7). Suhakam chairman Tan Sri Razali Ismail had said that the decision to hold the Human Rights Day celebration on Saturday (Dec 8) at Padang Timur was decided back in October. He said the date for the celebration was decided on Oct 18, in accordance with a date provided by the Pri...

content.title: 議長は議会でIcerdを議論するAnwarの動きを拒否する -  The Star Online
content.desc: KUALA LUMPUR: Dewan Rakyat speaker Datuk Mohamad Ariff Md Yusof (pic) rejected a motion by Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim to discuss the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (Icerd) in Parliament on Thursday (Dec 6). Anwar (PH-Port Dickson) asked Mohammad Ariff to allow the motion as lawmakers from across the political divide had supported the Cabinet's recent decision not to ratify Icerd. However, Mohamad Ariff rejected the motion under Parliament Standing Order 18(1). Anwar said that there had been misinterpretation over Icerd, which had led to confu...

content.title: アンワルは、主催者の抗ICERDラリー招待、政府のスタンスが十分に強いとは言わない - スターオンライン
content.desc: PKR president and Port Dickson MP Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has snubbed an invitation by the organisers to attend the anti-ICERD rally on Dec 8. He said he would bring up a motion in Parliament to support the government’s decision to not ratify the United Nations’ convention ICERD (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination). Read more at: https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/12/06/anwar-no-to-organiser-anti-icerd-rally-invite

content.title: ICERDの抗議集会と同じ日にM博士がICERDの集会を開始 - マレーシア・トゥデー
content.desc: (The Star) – Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will be launching a pro-human rights rally on the same day as the anti-Icerd rally on Saturday (Dec 8). The Human Rights Commission (Suhakam) is holding its first pro-human rights rally themed “Stand Up 4 Human Rights” in conjunction with International Human Rights Day that falls on Monday (Dec 10). The rally will be held from 9am to 3pm at Padang Timur in Petaling Jaya, while the rally against the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (Icerd) will be held about 10km away at Dataran Merdeka, Kual...

content.desc: PETALING JAYA: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will be launching a pro-human rights rally on the same day as the anti-Icerd rally. The two opposing rallies are scheduled for Saturday (Dec 8), with the Human Rights Commission (Suhakam) is holding its first pro-human rights rally themed "Stand Up 4 Human Rights". The rally will be held from 9am to 3pm at Padang Timur in Petaling Jaya, while the rally against the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (Icerd) will be held about 10km away at Dataran Merdeka, Kuala Lumpur. Dr Mahathir is also sch...

content.title: グループ：問題解決のために集会を中止 - マレーシア・トゥデイ
content.desc: “Maybe they want to protect their image because they started it (the protest). But when the government made the decision not to ratify it, they have lost the cause” (The Star) – Calls have grown louder for Saturday’s anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally to be cancelled. Although the Kuala Lumpur City Hall and the police have given the organisers the green light for the rally to proceed, moderate activists, as well as two mufti, felt it was still not too late for the gathering to be called off. Moderation advocate Mohamed Tawfik...

content.title: ナスリは反ICERD集会に参加しない、政府の決定に満足している - スターオンライン
content.desc: KUALA LUMPUR: Barisan Nasional secretary-general Datuk Seri Nazri Aziz is sitting out the anti-ICERD rally as he is satisfied with the government's decision to not ratify the anti-racial discrimination convention. “I won’t attend. I’m very focused on what I want from the government – that is, for them to retract the decision to ratify it, and they've done that. I’m satisfied. “If we can’t believe the Prime Minister then who can we believe?” he told reporters at the Parliament lobby here on Tuesday (Dec 4). Saying that the ICERD is “no longer an issue”, Umno’s Padang Rengas MP stressed that ...
